hackathon-description-text: Join us for 24 hours as we build apps, hardware and more at the beautiful UT Dallas campus. Whether you're a seasoned hackathon goer or just getting started, we'd love to see you there.

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Co-Founder of ACM at UTD and Product Designer at Mailchimp

hackathon-eligibility: Only 4 people will receive prizes per team, so try to keep your team under that number.
hackathon-requirements:
1) Enter name of your hack.

3) Submit a link to your hack (if applicable).

5) Seriously, don't submit late.
hackathon-rules:
1) Don't cheat.
2) Don't steal.
3) Don't hurt anyone.
4) If you have to ask "Is this legal?" It probably isn't. Don't do it.
5) Only go to rooms that are allowed for use by HackUTD.
6) Respect the building, the police, and the staff.
7) Abide by the

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Xbox One S 500GB Console - Battlefield 1 Bundle
UE BOOM 2 BrainFreeze Wireless Mobile Bluetooth Speaker
Holy Stone HS170 Predator Mini RC Helicopter Drone
Two tickets to QuantCon in NYC

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Amazon Web Services - Best Use of AWS

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Use your tech skills for good and hack online harassment. Build a software solution that can help reduce the frequency and/or severity of online harassment. Win HackHarassment Power Bank.

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Will be announced later in the morning

hackathon-location-description: The University of Texas at Dallas
